views.markdown:
iOS 10 Only,

Harp- Feel a nudge when you control the music.

Harp uses different haptic gestures to provide intuitive feedback, read below for an exact layout of current version:

Play/Pause: Strong tap feedback
Previous/Skip Track: Double tap feedback

Volume Scrubber:
- Volume Scrubber Touched: Light tap feedback

- Minimum Volume Set to zero (Muted): No feedback
Max Volume Set: Strong tap feedback

Audio Scrubber:
Scrubbing began: Light tap feedback
Scrubbing ended: Strong tap feedback

CC Now Playing Art/Metadata: Light tap feedback

Compatible with other music tweaks. Respring is not needed to enable/disable. Please considermy work if you hope to see more features/updates, hope you enjoy!

Configure options from Settings.

3.0 Update: initial Music.app support Harp feedback has been promoted to standard volume feedback 2.0.1 -> 2.0.2

-New Harp type feedback, try it out solo or even mix with adaptive feedback
-slightly smarter

thanks for installing
Harp 2.0(-1) > 2.0.1

-Adjusted experimental volume toggle

-Updated settings page & icons

appreciate all feedback, thanks for installing & hope you enjoy


Harp 2.0

Haptic Feedback Overhaul!

After personal testing, I have upgraded/revitalized the haptic feedback of Harp. Also shoutout/first to suggest adding some was an amazing developer named ca13bra1 who's open source stuff has been an immense help to me

Harp now uses three different forms of feedback to provide intuitive feedback, read below for an exact layout of current version:

Play/Pause: Strong tap feedback
Previous/Skip Track: Double tap feedback

Volume Scrubber:
- Volume Scrubber Touched: Light tap feedback
- Minimum Volume Set (Muted): No feedback
Max Volume Set: Strong tap feedback

Audio Scrubber:
Scrubbing began: Light tap feedback
Scrubbing ended: Strong tap feedback

CC Now Playing Art/Metadata: Light tap feedback

it feels a lot closer to perfection, I hope everyone enjoys. Please consider donating so I can get an Apple Music subscription : )
